Loss of identity: People would struggle to understand their own identities and sense of self without their memories. This could lead to a loss of personal identity and a sense of disconnection from their past experiences.
Difficulty in communication: Without memories, people would struggle to communicate effectively, as they would not be able to recall shared experiences or understand the context of conversations.

Difficulty in learning: Without memories, people would struggle to learn new information, as they would not be able to recall previous learning experiences or understand the context of new information.
Difficulty in problem-solving: Without memories, people would struggle to solve problems, as they would not be able to recall previous solutions or understand the context of new problems.
Difficulty in creativity: Without memories, people would struggle to be creative, as they would not be able to recall previous experiences or understand the context of new ideas.
